job.description:
{"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "JobPosting", "datePosted": "2021-08-31T00:07:50.000Z", "description": "

100% onsite


Responsibilities include but are not limited to:


  • Independently execute in vitro assays to evaluate the efficacy and specificity of immune cell-engaging biotherapeutics. Including NK and T cell assays from human PBMC using cytokine and flow cytometry readouts amongst others.
  • Apply knowledge of immune cell function and relevant technical skills to develop novel assay systems and provide biology support for development of next-generation immune cell engagers \u2013 including use of both cellular and molecular skills
  • Collaborate effectively across multiple projects and groups in a matrixed environment to develop positive relationships and help drive synergistic outcomes.
  • Anticipate the need for contingencies and demonstrate flexibility through development of alternative strategies to achieve outcomes.
  • Present project updates to project teams, managers and working groups.
  • Provide written reports to support regulatory documents and invention disclosures.
  • Provide and assist training of colleagues on lab techniques and equipment.
  • Maintain knowledge of relevant assays and science through the literature and other sources.
  • Assist in routine maintenance of laboratory equipment and resources.


Qualifications:


  • M.S. in immunology, immuno-oncology, or a related field with minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience or B.S. with minimum of 4 years of relevant work experience in relevant fields. Industry experience preferred.
  • Experience with immune and oncology related cell types including subset of T cells, NK cells, transformed tumor cells. Basic knowledge of T/NK cell biology and hands-on experience is strongly preferred.
  • Experience with technologies typically employed to assess immune cell function including but not limited to subset of multi-color flow cytometry, Luminex, MSD, IncuCyte-based assays, T/NK cell activation assays, ADCC assays, T/NK cell proliferation assays, 3-D cell cultures, imaging technologies.
  • Experience in genetic transduction and characterization of cells in vitro preferred.
  • Self-motivated and able to work on multiple projects in a matrix environment.
  • Ability to work well as both team member and as individual contributor is essential.
  • Excellent oral communication skills for cross-functional interactions.
  • Requires strong organizational skills to ensure thorough and timely documentation of experiments, and preparation of data for compiling reports.
  • Experience with antibody drug discovery is an advantage.
